explanation: Bake, Roast, Grill, and Fry are all methods of cooking food using heat. Dice is a method of cutting food, not cooking it.

Clio, Erato, Calliope, and Thalia are all among the nine Muses, goddesses who inspired the arts and sciences in Greek mythology. Artemis is a prominent Olympian goddess, but she is not one of the Muses.

Bed (headboard), Nail (head of a nail), River (riverhead/headwaters), and Pin (pinhead) all commonly use the word 'head' to describe a specific part or origin. A table does not typically have a 'head'.
